metadata.title: CVE-2019-2228 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In array_find of array.c, there is a possible out-of-bounds read due to anincorrect bounds check. This could lead to local information disclosure inthe printer spooler with no additional execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions:Android-8.0 Android-8.1 Android-9 Android-10Android ID: A-111210196

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2228` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
cups-bsd - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
cups-client - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
cups-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
cups-core-drivers - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
cups-daemon - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
cups-ipp-utils - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
cups-ppdc - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
cups-server-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
libcups2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
libcupscgi1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
libcupsimage2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
libcupsmime1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
libcupsppdc1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cups package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.7-1ubuntu2.8').
